title: Literature review examines suicide risk during COVID‐19
abstract: Observing that the current pandemic presents many challenges, including the chances of a significant increase in suicide risk, vigilance and care are needed for mental health well‐being to limit the spread of suicide, say researchers of a new literature review that examines the risk factors for suicide during the pandemic. Lesser‐known mental health issues, such as post‐traumatic stress disorder, may also affect those infected with the virus and those who are not, they stated.
